fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37142].
  {panel}

Use case:
Bob and Sally are both editing story 123. Bob saves his changes first and so when Sally saves her changes she has overwritten Bob's changes without even knowing it (without performing some forensics in the story's history). This last write win is undesired.

Better would be to use an optimistic locking mechanism where a version/revision number is saved on the story that is incremented each time it is modified. This version is then checked when saving (often by providing the version in the sql query's where clause) and rejecting the update if an old version is being updated.

To revisit the Bob/Sally example:
Bob and Sally are editing version 1 of the story. When Bob saves his changes the version is incremented to 2. When Sally saves her changes the system detects that an old version is being saved and would reject with a message that the story has been updated while she was editing it. Or at least warn Sally that she's about to overwrite another user's changes--maybe with a yes/no prompt to let her confirm that's what she wants to do.
fields.summary: Notify user when editing a story will overwrite another user's changes
Bulk change Date fields with Relative date instead of Absolute date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37125].
  {panel}

When you triage or otherwise edit an issue, you can't then read the details in the issue.  Nor can you select to copy/paste form them.

This is a pretty significant usability issue.  Surprised that is not obvious to  your UX folks.

Use case:
I read a review a new bug.  Click triage and then assign and type a comment. But I need to re-read a bit of the details to write the correct comment / suggestion on a fix.  But alas, I need to open a new browser window, open the ticket and read it.  Uggh!

2nd use case:
Same triage scenario but I need to decide who to assign to.  I need to see the person who submitted.  Today I can widen the browser window to see on the right but I should not need to.

I'd suggest make the modal dialogs resizable and movable.
fields.summary: Need easy way to see issue details while performing edit actions in modal dialg

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37123].
  {panel}

The right margin where the basic bug info (people, dates, agile) results in signuificant waste of space once you scroll down.  

For example, see the two attachements. 
bug_screen_scrolled.png - shows how, once you scroll down you are left with white space to the right of the bug details where it could otherwise be allowing for a wider display for the bug details

Can this be optimzied so that the description and comments use the right margin.    All the other fields can still take a the more narrow region.   Thus, the layout becomes like a "T" (left / right on top and full width below that).
fields.summary: Right margin below the basic issue info results in a significant waste of space
Explanation for the 500 users limit for JIRA authentication

fields.description:
For some reason, we keep getting this message when browsing to our Jira instance:
-----
We've detected a potential problem with JIRA's Dashboard configuration that your administrator can correct.
Dashboard Diagnostics: Mismatched URL Port
JIRA is reporting that it is running on the port '8080', which does not match the hostname used to run these diagnostics, '80'. This is known to cause JIRA to construct URLs using the incorrect port, which will result in errors in the dashboard, among other issues.
The most common cause of this is the use of a reverse-proxy HTTP server (often Apache or IIS) in front of the application server running JIRA. While this configuration is supported, some additional setup might be necessary in order to ensure that JIRA detects the correct port.
------
The server.xml file appears to be correct (only the relevant section included):
----
<Connector port="8080"

                   maxThreads="150"
                   minSpareThreads="25"
                   connectionTimeout="20000"

                   enableLookups="false"
                   maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
                   protocol="HTTP/1.1"
                   useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
                   redirectPort="8443"
                   acceptCount="100"
                   disableUploadTimeout="true"/>
                   proxyName="issues.practichem.com"
                   proxyPort="80"
        <!--
-----
I'm not at all certain why this is popping up.  What can I do to fix this?
fields.summary: Mismatched port warning message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37088].
  {panel}

When we raise a defect we have an option 'Attachments' , wherein we attach the screenshots of the issue so that the developer gets a better understanding about the issue.

Am attaching a screenshot while creating a defect it has a name say for example 'abc'. 
When I attach another screenshot with same name 'abc'. 
It allows me to attach the screenshot. This causes a lot of issues.

When a tester attaches a screenshot with the name 'abc' and a developer after fixing defect if he/she attaches a screenshot with the same name 'abc',confusion arises.


Suggested solution : 
JIRA shouldn't allow attachment of screenshots with the same name to avoid confusions
fields.summary: Improvements suggested to increase the clarity while attaching screenshots

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37084].
  {panel}

 When we raise a defect we have an option 'Attachments' , wherein we attach the screenshots of the issue so that the developer gets a better understanding about the issue.

Once the developer fixes the defect , he/she attaches the screenshot of the issue being fixed and updates it in the defect through 'Attachments' option

Then the tester retests the defect and if the defect still exists he/she attaches the screenshot of the issue that stills exists and updates the same in the defect through 'Attachments' option

The issue comes here. 
1. The tester attaches the screenshot with a name say 'xyz'. 
2. The developer fixes the issue and attaches the screenshot with a name 'abc'. 
3. The tester retests the issue and attaches the screenshot (with a name 'mns') to prove that the issue still exists 
4. The tester retests the issue and attaches the screenshot (with a name 'opq') to prove that the issue doesn't exist anymore and its working fine  

Now when someone (apart from that tester/developer) sees this defect its very difficult to understand the screenshots attached.

 He/she will not know the below :
1. which screenshot is attached by the tester that depicts the issue ?
2. which screenshot is attached by the developer to show that he has fixed the issue ?
3. which screenshot is attached by the tester after retesting to prove that the issue still exists  ?
4. which screenshot is attached by the tester after retesting to prove that the issue doesnt exists anymore and its working fine  ?


Few new options can be introduced while we attach the screenshot , like
1.  Screenshot attached by tester while raising the defect
2.  Screenshot attached by developer after fixing the defect
3.  Screenshot attached by tester after retesting the defect

These options can be given at the time we raise a defect or edit the defect. We can attach the screenshots to the respective options, which will be displayed on the defect page as separate entities.

This improves the clarity on the screenshots attached and dispels ambiguity
fields.summary: Improvements related to 'Attachments' in defect
Error on Table Audit_Log during update from 6.1.7 to 6.2

h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA 6.2, as per [JIRA 6.2 Upgrade Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+6.2+Upgrade+Notes], the labels functionality in projects was removed.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Add the labels functionality back in.

fields.summary: Jira OnDemand Comment required validator for workflow transitions always errors

fields.description:
Hi,

Our client, who uses JIRA with us, frequently complains about the useless state of this feature, so I checked it out myself.

This particular test system is running OS X Mavericks, Java Version 7 Update 51, Google Chrome 32.0.1700.107 and Mozilla Firefox 27.0.1.

These are my findings:

* Google Chrome has abysmal support for Java, so you pretty much can't use Chrome to use this feature.

* When using Firefox, if the popup window seems stuck on the Java logo, click on the logo and the correct form appears.

* If this works, it requires you to have stored the screenshot in your clipboard. On Mac OS X, this can be done like so:
** Command+Control+Shift+3: takes a screenshot of the entire screen and saves it to the Clipboard
** Command+Control+Shift+4: enables you to select an area, which it takes a screenshot of and saves it to the Clipboard

* HOWEVER, in my tests in Firefox, after hitting the paste button, the form becomes completely unresponsive.
fields.summary: Attach a Screenshot feature completely broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37076].
  {panel}

Monospaced formatting adds a border intended for *\{noformat\}* and *\{code\}*

The _Text Formatting Notation Help_ page shows monospaced should look like this:
!http://i.imgur.com/AS3RAP2.png!

However when {color:black}\{\{{color}monospaced{color:black}\}\}{color} is rendered, it looks like this:
!http://i.imgur.com/1rKX9z8.png!

The border seems to be more appropriate for the \{noformat\} and \{code\} tag, but not inline monospaced text.
fields.summary: Monospaced formatting adds border

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37068].
  {panel}

h3. How it works

When I click on the "Add new gadget" page, inside a dashboard, I get a list of Gadgets with a short description of it and a link to it's XML.

h3. How I would like it to work 

When I click on the "Add new gadget" page, inside a dashboard, I get a list of Gadgets with a short description of it, a link to it's XML and a link to the Gadget's documentation page.
The idea is to make it easier for the user to see the Gadgets documentation, reducing their need to open tickets with doubts regarding functionalities.
fields.summary: Add link to Gadgets documentation on Add New Gadget page

But I need to be able to configure the workflow on certain issue types so that it only appear on 1 board

Open status => dev backlog
Needs to be allocated to sprint by d scrum master for work to be done on bugs
Then  technical tasks can be moved to dev backlog after create and the test subtask can move to the qa backlog after create.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37060].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA project source tab only applicable for FishEye plugin where only exclusively for FishEye commits summary. It will be great that Project Source Tab able to show any GIT/STASH info.

*Scenario:*
* If a JIRA project is linked to FECRU Repo/Project - populate the Source tab from there
* If a JIRA project is linked to STASH Project - populate the Source tab from there
* If a JIRA project is linked to both FISHEYE and STASH - populate the Source tab from both
* If a JIRA project is not linked to any VCS disable the Source tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37058].
  {panel}

If a user logs in and creates an issue without filling in a required field, an error message is presented like this:
!login.png|thumbnail!

If anonymous issues are allowed according to [Allowing users to create issues anonymously|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Allowing+users+to+create+issues+anonymously], no such error message is presented if a required field is left empty by an anonymous user:
!anonymous.png|thumbnail!

Without awareness, users may not know why they cannot create issues.
fields.summary: No Error Message of Empty Required Field/s when creating Anonymous Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37057].
  {panel}

Currently, these two permissions are combined within the one "Browse Projects" permission. 

The double personality of this permission causes confusion to administrator users as it is not obvious how the issue-specific values for these permissions ("security types" in JIRA code-speak) should behave in the project meaning of those permissions. 

Examples of these values are: "Current Assignee", "Current Reporter" ... 

[~mlassau] has agreed to provide architectural advice and technical review for this work.

[~mlassau] Could you please add initial design/implementation notes for [~aglowacki] here? 

Thanks mate.

CC: [~vosipov]
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like to be able to grant permissions to browse projects and to browse issues independently
User Management - Show active/deactive status in user listing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37054].
  {panel}

h2. Steps to reproduce


- Go to confluence and delete your jira acess token http://confluence/users/revokeoauthtokens.action
- Create a new confluence page with a colon ( : ) on its name. Page url should be something like http://confluence/something/yourpagewithcolon:intherurl
- In a test issue try to link that recently created confluence  page.
- It'll ask you to do the login dance. Do it
- Click on link button
- [ BUG ] It'll prompt again to do the login dance. No matter how many times you do the dance, it won't accept the link. And it will create as much tokens for the jira instance on confluence as tries to do the dance.

*Note that this only ocurrs with that particular url I've tried a clean url one https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~scia/test and it works fine.*

h2. Workaround

- On the confluence page you want to link go to Tools/Page History
- Click on CURRENT version link
- Use that url to link to the issue. (Should be something similar to _yoursite.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=number_)
fields.summary: Confluence pages containing a colon cannot be linked to an issue if you need to do login dance first.

fields.description: Currently I have a notification set up for a filter to notify me every 2 hours.  Since there are a few open issues in the filter, I get notified every 2 hours.  What I really want is to be notified there is a NEW issue in the filter.  I can't set this up on a project basis,
fields.summary: JIRA filter subscriptions - only notify with NEW issues
Could not find a handler capable of installing the add-on at atlassian-plugin.xml. Check that the file is a valid add-on. (TFS4JIRA)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37051].
  {panel}

Customer would like to make Two Dimensional Statistics available at the option Export > On Dashboard in the Issue View screen.
Today we don't have this option available.

h3. Workaround
Add the Two Dimensional Statistics directly at the Dashboard using the option + Add Gadget.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37050].
  {panel}

As a Jira admin, 
I want to select "Any standard issue type" or "Any subtask issue type" when configuring a custom field, 
So that I do not have to come back and add any new issues types created later.

Note:  Under "Choose applicable issue types", you can already select issue types individually, or collectively as "Any issue type".

-Johnny

Limiting Stash/Fisheye/Git/Bitbucket/Subversion per project
Team Shortcuts to be available on JIRA Standalone BTF

fields.description:
I'm setting up Jira for handling incoming emails and make tickets from them.
In order to test this procedure, i've added an test-project, an emailserver and an email handler.

using the test buttons of the emailserver and the email handler worked fine.
Also the first email that i send to the email test account worked fine.

In the 2nd mail I have added an attachment (.png picture).
In the 3rd mail I added a screen print.

Since i have send these emails, Jira will not add any tasks to my test-project anymore. In the database the issue numbers are raised (issuenumber for this test-project is now 158, but i only have 1 issue).
In the log files I see that something seems to be stuck in adding issues.
(log files are attached)

Could you pls advise me about what is going wrong?
fields.summary: Trouble with making issues through incoming mail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37033].
  {panel}

Hi, Atlassian

I want to suggest a extension gadget from Filter Results gadget.

When description field has contents have any lines, the other field has empty space. 
To use this empty space efficiently, I think if some fields have single line content could be coupled by configuration, then it can be displayed vertically combined field.

You can see detailed information in attached images.

Regards, 
Cheolmin
fields.summary: vertical combined field display at Filter Results Gadget
setenv.sh - use values from shell environment
Show Tabs When User Chooses to Show Custom Set of Fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37024].
  {panel}

Hi,

some month ago we switched from Mantis to JIRA. One of the features we're really missing is a background-color for columns - depending on the status the ticket actually has.

Our current workaround is the script from http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/134394

I attached a screenshot how it looks like when I view all my tickets, ordered by status ASC, updated DESC.

You can see at first sight that it's much clearer what kind of tickets are open, what status they have and how many there actually are for each status. This color also affects the ticket detail page, where the status column is still colored.

It's fine for me with the script, but it is not for our customers. They don't know about the script, they don't know how to install a script, they don't want a script and - of course and most important - they shoudn't need a script.

Maybe it's possible for you to implement the userscript (see link above) as a standard tool. That would be really great.

As this setting could be optional, none of the current JIRA users would have any disadvantage.

Thank you!

Regards,
Martin
fields.summary: Different background-colors for different ticket status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37023].
  {panel}

Let's say you have some security levels set for a particular project, and in some levels there is a *Current Assignee* permission. 

If a user has the permission to create issues in a project, that user is able to select *any* issue security level which has the Current Assignee permission, even if the user can't be assigned due to other permissions.
This holds in the following scenarios:
# The user is NOT an Assignable User.
# The user is NOT the default assignee as per the project config.

The user then ends up creating an issue which he/she cannot see due to the other permissions as per above.

There should be a check for Assignable User before allowing the user to see and select those security levels.
fields.summary: Current Assignee on a security level allows a user creating issues to select these security levels even if that user cannot be assigned

fields.description: The user Menu on the top right should not contain a link to the marketplace by default, as it is not on this site either. See screenshot. On a sidenote, it is very annoying that the agile link can not be removed either, customers have absolutely no business what so ever using agile. It is hard enough as it is to get clients to actually use a bug tracker...
fields.summary: User Menu Bug

fields.description:
The ticket links in the email notification prior to JIRA upgrade (6.1.7) are not working. 

Previously URL from any JIRA tickets was like http://our-jira.com/jira/browse/TICKST-123 and now there is no /jira as per 6.1.7, the new url is like http://our-url.com//browse/TICKST-123.

The issue is -

 when we are creating ticket in the instance after upgrtade we are getting email notification perfectly and able to open the tickets from email without any issue 

but.. 

when we open a ticket recieved in email before upgrade are diverting to URL with /jira in it as described above and getting below error -

{code}
Please look for misspellings in the address:
http://our-jira.com:8080/jira/browse/TICKET-123
{code}

And when we remove /jira from URL it works fine.

So - how we can divert old links to the new links. I mean how can we open old tickets from email without any error and without manually removing /jira.

Please help us to resolve this issue ASAP as this is production and we are in mid of process of upgrading.
fields.summary: Old URL is not working after upgrading JIRA to 6.1.7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37020].
  {panel}

We get several confusions in email/comment section threads under issues as the comment in the issue does not show the fact that this comment was added when assigning (making the assigner thinking he is adressing the assignee specifically, but in reality he is adding a comment for all to see). 

This is what it currently looks like in the title of a comment: 
[img] <Sirland, David> added a comment - 2014-02-10 09:58

What if the line changes if it matches with an assign-action?
[img] <Sirland, David> assigned issue to <ASSIGNE NAME> and added a comment - 2014-02-10 09:58

Would make my life easier! :D
fields.summary: When assigning an issue to a new person, clarify this in the comments section.
Keep me in Space Admin context

fields.description: My plugin uses expenders and since 6.2-rc1, they are no longer working. I also tried the demo from the sandbox and even that one is not working.
fields.summary: Expenders are no longer working in JIRA 6.2-rc1
I would like to request an 'tar/gz' option when upgrading jira through the installer

this is not showing up on my on-demand jira instance.

I have to create a filter for that: user = current user and status != close

why?
fields.summary: assigned to me does not display my issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37008].
  {panel}

Detail View (implemented in JIRA 6) causes great pain for my support team.
* Minimal display real-estate causes fields to be overlapped
* Custom HTML/java in Add-on custom field types (like database tables) won't display properly
* Not all fields are editable in Detail View
* Issue Collectors do not capture Browser and Source Issue ID when the collector is activated while viewing an issue in Detail View.

List view worked fine for our users. We want to remove Detail View from our system all together. 
I may be forced to downgrade to 5.x if this can't be addressed. I've seen lots of other requests for this but no response from Atlassian yet...
fields.summary: Administrator ability to DISABLE Detail View in Issue Navigator - GLOBALLY

fields.description:
I keep running in to the following error trying to push in the data from our production system to test.
System Ubuntu 12.04LTS VM
2GB Ram
psql database

Error:
2014-01-29 15:37:41,920 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR Admin 925x192x1 17id0gl 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Exception thrown during upgrade: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.opensymphony.workflow.FactoryException: Error converting XML to workflow descriptor.: root cause: Attribute "name" is required and must be specified for element type "action". (line:425 col:26)

How I have tried to get this to run.
On our Sandbox server i tried an upgrade and it failed with the same error. On my VM i tried to import during setup then fully setup jira and tried to restore.

Update: on the 6.2 Beta I am getting the same error trying to push in the data.
fields.summary: Data Base error upgrading from 6.1.5 or 6.1.7 (Test box)
Switching issue type scheme inside a project should publish an event of some kind inside JIRA.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37004].
  {panel}

This is based on feedback from a customer:

Is there a better way to handle many of the different Errors and NPEs that JIRA users may encounter (resulting from special cases of invalid Issue Field data/ database inconsistency) when trying to access JIRA issues, projects etc., such that instead of just throwing a stacktrace without any other useful content, that some of the available requested data is displayed wherever possible and wherever it is valid to do so, and a compact error message about the data inconsistency is shown on the interface?

For instance, an NPE is thrown due to an invalid workflow status when trying to access an issue. Instead of not being able to view the issue data at all. Is it possible to still render the valid aspects of the issue/project data and then just show a warning error that alerts the user to the database corruption? And then prevent changes that may make the invalid data cause additional problems. Also, the full stack trace can still be hidden in a expansible panel as is already obtainable in JIRA.

Implementing this perhaps may introduce more resource implications, levels of complexity and perhaps other unpredictable behaviour in the programming logic, and I mentioned this to our customer who raised it. However, I'd leave it to developers to determine what level of improvement can be made to handling issue rendering under these special circumstances.
fields.summary: Improve Error/Exception handling, such that it's still possible to view issues even when some field data is broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37003].
  {panel}

Loading administration page for project with a large number of issue type will hit the "Down for maintenance" screen.
It is suspected to be HTTP request timing out.

It's a risk for all Projects that use the Default Issue Type Scheme, as it includes all Issue Types in the JIRA instance and could gradually grow to a level that will result in timeout errors.

*Workaround:* 
create smaller Issue Type Schemes for specific Projects.
fields.summary: Loading Project Administation page for Projects with a large number of Issue Types times out and shows the maintenance screen
Version Picker (single version) and Single Select List Auto-Complete
Issue type for a specific user in a project
Add a Version release webHook

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36993].
  {panel}

One of the JIRA Admin Helper plugin feature is to check a particular permission on a particular user, which is called the Permission Helper.

Because the Permission Helper screen is not rendered to be scrollable, the "Submit" and "Close" button is missing from view. As you can see in the following screenshot

!permhelp.png!

*Workaround:* Press "Enter" to "Submit" and "Esc" to "Close"
fields.summary: Permission Helper screen should be scrollable

fields.description:
This doesn't happen often, but on some issues, we are not able to close/reopen issues anymore:

!Untitled.png!

Reindexing doesn't help. Nothing is being logged in JIRA log.
fields.summary: Communications Breakdown error when trying to Close/Reopen several issues
Replace or extend "Manage Watcher List" permission with "Add watchers" and "Remove watchers" permissions

ndodds@educause.edu

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36987].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a Date Picker custom field and assign it to the Default Screen:
!date_picker_1.JPG|thumbnail!

* Create a few issues in the project and ensure that the value for the Date Picker is included too:
!date_picker_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* Add the Time Since Chart into the Dashboard and ensure that the Date Picker custom field is chosen for the *Date Field* option:
!date_picker_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* You will encounter the *An internal server error occurred when requesting resource* when you click on the Save button:
!date_picker_4.JPG|thumbnail!

fields.description:
I'm the administrator of my Jira OnDemand instance.

As such I should have rights to create a new project. As a matter of fact I've already created 4 projects but today I've tried to create another project and was not able to create it.

After all screens I got an error. The project is not created but interestenly if I try to repeat when I try to put the same name for the new project it states "there is a project with same name"

Search across all projects for custom version fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36975].
  {panel}

Currently I can create a custom group picker field which allows users to select a group. I can also set the notification scheme based on the custom group picker field and all members of the group will receive an email based on the event. 

As a JIRA Admin, I would like to see this same ability for the Project Role.
# Create a custom Project Role picker field
# Create a notification that will email all users based on the custom Project Role picker field.

Justification:
As a Project Admin, I can not add/remove users from Groups. As users move on an off the team, I must contact the JIRA Admin to modify the groups.
As a JIRA Admin, I do not want to support/administer project specific groups. This defeats the point of Project Roles and requires a high level of support for large installations
fields.summary: Project Role Picker
Add the 'repository name' field to FishEye commits in JIRA Activity Stream

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36973].
  {panel}

Hello JIRA team,

I would like to propose an enhancement for JIRA that will IMO benefit all agile/lean teams out there. 

=========
Narrative
=========

AS a team member

I WANT jira to stop me from going above my defined WIP limit

SO that I can stop starting and start finalizing

================================================
Scenarios (examples based on classes of services aka CoS)
================================================

GIVEN an attempt to assign an issue to a user

WHEN the issue is expedite and there is one current expedite issue assigned

THEN do not accept the assignment

WHEN the issue is non expedite (fixed delivery date, standard or intangible) and there are two current non expedite issues assigned

THEN do not accept the assignment

==========================================================
Implementation proposal (applicable to any kind of scenarios including the above)
==========================================================

Note how the two WHEN can be expressed as a JQL filter, an operator and a result count. Let us call them Personal WIP rules:

filter, operator, count

PWIP rule1: CoS = "expedite", <=, 1

PWIP rule2: CoS in ("fixed delivery date", "standard", "intangible"), <=, 2

These rules should be assigned to user roles.

Suppose some user (the originator) attempts to assign a candidate issue to another user or self (the target). The system will count the current tickets assigned based on the filter rules for the target user, will apply the filter rules for the candidate issue and if a filter condition is matched then the count will increase for that filter. The rules will trigger and only if the user can accept the ticket the operation will be successful.

In fact the target user should not even be presented as a candidate to resolve the ticket. At a minimum, as stated above, the validation of the submission should fail. The result should be an error like "Could not perform this action. Personal WIP limit reached"

Thanks!

- Nestor
fields.summary: Setting Personal WIP or WIP limits per user
Renamed users break existing filters
